Lesson_name: Explaining Important System and Network Architecture Concepts
Personally Identifiable Information (PII: Describes sensitive PPI such as US social security numbers, biometrics, financial records, medical records, immigration identifiers, etc.
Protected health information (PHI): wide range of information and includes not only patients but also doctors and healthcare systems. It describes information about past,  present, or future health, as well as related payments.
Personal Identifiable financial informat: payment history, credit ratings, and financial statements. other thing like account numbers, credit/debt card numbers, personal information.
Card holder Data: related to the owner of a payment card. cardholder name, card number, billing adress.and privacy regulations such as Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS), the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA), and others.
Intellectual property: Intangible products of human thought and ingenuity. copyrights patents, trademarks, and trade secretss. Often represents vast sums of investment money, research and time.
